title: Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil actually repeats atop the box office with $19.4M to beat out Joker
text:
Disney's Maleficent: Mistress of Evil wound up repeating atop the box office after all, despite Sunday's studio estimates putting it below Warner Bros.' Joker.

The Sunday estimates put Joker returning to top the box office with $18.9 million just ahead of Maleficent: Mistress of Evil's $18.5 million.

But, according to The Hollywood Reporter, the actual figures put Maleficent: Mistress of Evil on top with $19.4 million, ahead of Joker's $19.2 million.

Box office mistress: Disney's Maleficent: Mistress of Evil wound up repeating atop the box office after all, despite Sunday's studio estimates putting it below Warner Bros.' Joker

The tallies for both Maleficent: Mistress of Evil and Joker both reflect their staying power, with Maleficent: Mistress of Evil dropping 47.6% and Joker just 34.2%.

Maleficent's $36.9 million debut was considered disappointing by most standards, nearly half of the $69.4 million debut of Maleficent in 2014.

However, the sequel has fared well overseas with $229.4 million from foreign markets for a worldwide total of $295.6 million from a huge $185 million budget.

Staying power: The tallies for both Maleficent: Mistress of Evil and Joker both reflect their staying power, with Maleficent: Mistress of Evil dropping 47.6% and Joker just 34.2%

While Joker failed to reclaim the weekend box office crown, it's still one of the year's highest highest grossing films.

Joker has pulled in $277.9 million at the domestic box office (the seventh-highest domestic gross this year) and $574.1 million internationally for $852 million worldwide.

It became the first R-rated movie to cross the $800 million worldwide threshold, and broke Deadpool's record for the highest-grossing R-rated movie worldwide.

Happy face: While Joker failed to reclaim the weekend box office crown, it's still one of the year's highest highest grossing films

It still has some work to do to beat Deadpool's domestic R-rated record of $363 million, but with Joker produced on just a $60 million budget, it's one of the most profitable movies of the year, and of all time.

Heading into next weekend, both Maleficent and Joker will likely cede the box office crown to Paramount's highly-anticipated Terminator: Dark Fate.

Deadline has projected that Terminator: Dark Fate will debut with roughly $40 million when it hits theaters November 1.

Joker: It still has some work to do to beat Deadpool's domestic R-rated record of $363 million, but with Joker produced on just a $60 million budget, it's one of the most profitable movies of the year, and of all time

The top 5 at the box office was rounded out by The Addams Family with $12 million, followed by newcomer Countdown with $8.8 million and Zombieland: Double Tap, which dropped a whopping 67.5% from third place to fifth place with $8.7 million.

Rounding out the top 10 is newcomer Black and Blue with $8.3 million, Gemini Man with $4.1 million, The Lighthouse with $3 million, The Current War $2.6 million and Abominable with $2 million.

Sony also re-released the summer hit Once Upon a Time in Hollywood with four brand new scenes, earning $555,485 from 1,674 theaters.
description: Disney's Maleficent: Mistress of Evil wound up repeating atop the box office after all, despite Sunday's studio estimates putting it below Warner Bros.' Joker.
